interestingFact: The country is a landlocked nation and is one of the world's largest producers of opium.
Albania has a unique tradition of 'sworn virgins,' women who live as men and are granted special rights and privileges.
Algeria is the largest country in Africa by land area.

Angola is home to the world's most expensive capital city, Luanda, which has a very high cost of living.

Argentina is the birthplace of the tango dance and has the world's highest per capita consumption of red meat.

Ethiopia is the only African country that was never colonized. It is also the origin of coffee.

Iran is home to one of the world's oldest continuous civilizations, with a history dating back over 7,000 years.

Lebanon is one of the only countries in the Middle East with no deserts, and its ancient Cedars of Lebanon are mentioned in the Bible.

Mali was once the center of the great Malian Empire, which was famous for its wealth and scholarship.
Malta is a small island nation with a rich history, and its capital, Valletta, is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

Saudi Arabia is home to the two holiest cities in Islam, Mecca and Medina, and has the world's second-largest oil reserves.

Slovenia has a small coastline on the Adriatic Sea and is home to the Postojna Cave, one of the world's largest karst cave systems.

South Africa has three capital cities and is home to a unique animal, the African penguin.

capital: Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte (legislative), Colombo (executive and judicial)
interestingFact: Sri Lanka is one of the world's oldest Buddhist countries and is known for its tea production.

Damascus is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.
Taiwan is a major global hub for technology and is often called the 'Silicon Island'.

Tonga is the last remaining kingdom in the South Pacific.

The ancient city of Carthage, a major power in the Mediterranean, was located near modern-day Tunis.

The United States is the world's third-largest country by land area and has the world's largest economy.
